oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-10-21 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 21, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, the Possum Hunters, Ford Rush, and Rachel Veach. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording ends with the start of the following Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Uncle Dave Macon; Possum Hunters; Ford Rush; Rachel Veach; Dorris Macon; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Pray For The Light To Go Out (Uncle Dave Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces the Possum Hunters -- Pull Off Your Overcoat (Possum Hunters) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Wonder Is All I Do (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach -- Ground Hog (Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Take Me Back To My Old Carolina Home (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Sourwood Mountain (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Charming Betsy (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone) -- Closing theme -- Station announcements -- George D. Hay introduces the Golden West Cowboys -- [Unidentified performance] (Pee Wee King, Golden West Cowboys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Story of Ellen Randolph (Radio program); Hitz, Elsie
